prompt: <description>Part 1: 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom. The cylindrical hole is centered and has a diameter that is half the width of the prism. The prism is positioned at a 45 degree angle from the viewer. Creating the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system: * Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0]. * Set the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0625, 0.0]. Creating the Sketch Now create the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. Face 1 For Face 1, create two loops: one for the outer rectangular shape and one for the inner circular hole. Loop 1 (Outer Rectangle) * Draw Line 1 from [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0]. * Draw Line 2 from [0.75, 0.0] to [0.625, 0.125]. * Draw Line 3 from [0.625, 0.125] to [0.3125, 0.125]. * Draw Arc 1 from [0.3125, 0.125] to [0.0625, 0.125] with the mid-point at [0.1875, 0.25]. * Draw Line 4 from [0.0625, 0.125] to [0.0, 0.125]. * Close Loop 1 by drawing Line 5 from [0, 0.125] to [0.0, 0.0]. Loop 2 (Inner Circle) * Draw Circle 1 centered at [0.1875, 0.125] with a radius of 0.0625. Extrusion Extrude Face 1 with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0625 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 This operation will create a new solid body for part 1.
